intro: Rhus clausseniana, commonly known as the Mexican sumac, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other plants like poison ivy and cashew. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically divided into several oval-shaped leaflets. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fuzzy berries that are edible for some bird species. Rhus clausseniana is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
